briefdescription.para: Mass information function signature, for given UsdPrim gather MassInformation.
Compile time constant representing what kind of schema this class is.
Construct a UsdPhysicsRigidBodyAPI on UsdPrim prim .

detaileddescription.para: Equivalent to UsdPhysicsRigidBodyAPI::Get(prim.GetStage(), prim.GetPath()) for a valid prim, but will not immediately throw an error for an invalid prim

briefdescription.para: Construct a UsdPhysicsRigidBodyAPI on the prim held by schemaObj .

detaileddescription.para: Should be preferred over UsdPhysicsRigidBodyAPI(schemaObj.GetPrim()), as it preserves SchemaBase state.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
Determines if this PhysicsRigidBodyAPI is enabled.
See GetRigidBodyEnabledAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Determines whether the body is kinematic or not.

detaileddescription.para: A kinematic body is a body that is moved through animated poses or through user defined poses. The simulation derives velocities for the kinematic body based on the external motion. When a continuous motion is not desired, this kinematic flag should be set to false.

briefdescription.para: See GetKinematicEnabledAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Determines if the body is asleep when the simulation starts.
See GetStartsAsleepAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Linear velocity in the same space as the node's xform.
See GetVelocityAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Angular velocity in the same space as the node's xform.
See GetAngularVelocityAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Single PhysicsScene that will simulate this body.

detaileddescription.para: By default this is the first PhysicsScene found in the stage using UsdStage::Traverse().

briefdescription.para: See GetSimulationOwnerRel(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.
Compute mass properties of the rigid body diagonalInertia Computed diagonal of the inertial tensor for the rigid body.

detaileddescription.para:
com Computed center of mass for the rigid body. principalAxes Inertia tensor's principal axes orienttion for the rigid body. massInfoFn Callback function to get collision mass information.
Computed mass of the rigid body

briefdescription.para: Return a vector of names of all pre-declared attributes for this schema class and all its ancestor classes.

detaileddescription.para: Does not include attributes that may be authored by custom/extended methods of the schemas involved.

briefdescription.para: Return a UsdPhysicsRigidBodyAPI holding the prim adhering to this schema at path on stage.

detaileddescription.para: If no prim exists at path on stage, or if the prim at that path does not adhere to this schema, return an invalid schema object. This is shorthand for the following:

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this single-apply API schema can be applied to the given prim.

detaileddescription.para: If this schema can not be a applied to the prim, this returns false and, if provided, populates whyNot with the reason it can not be applied.

Note that if CanApply returns false, that does not necessarily imply that calling Apply will fail. Callers are expected to call CanApply before calling Apply if they want to ensure that it is valid to apply a schema.

briefdescription.para: Applies this single-apply API schema to the given prim.

detaileddescription.para: This information is stored by adding "PhysicsRigidBodyAPI" to the token-valued, listOp metadata apiSchemas on the prim.

simplesect.para: A valid UsdPhysicsRigidBodyAPI object is returned upon success. An invalid (or empty) UsdPhysicsRigidBodyAPI object is returned upon failure. See UsdPrim::ApplyAPI() for conditions resulting in failure.

briefdescription.para: Returns the kind of schema this class belongs to.
Applies physics body attributes to any UsdGeomXformable prim and marks that prim to be driven by a simulation.

detaileddescription.para: If a simulation is running it will update this prim's pose. All prims in the hierarchy below this prim should move accordingly.
